meanings.definition: A substance used for destroying insects or other organisms harmful to cultivated plants or to animals.
meanings.sent1: Farmers use pesticide to protect their crops from pesky bugs.
meanings.sent2: The pesticide helped get rid of the harmful insects in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The ants threw a party when they heard the pesticide was coming to visit.
meanings.sent4: The pesticide acted like a shield, keeping the plants safe from invaders.
meanings.sent5: The pesticide sprayed on the leaves sparkled in the sunlight, a sign of protection.

meanings.definition: A chemical preparation for destroying plant, fungal, or animal pests.
meanings.sent1: The pesticide was effective in eliminating the unwanted pests from the fields.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners rely on pesticide to keep their plants healthy and pest-free.
meanings.sent3: The weeds in the garden ran away in fear of the pesticide.
meanings.sent4: The pesticide worked like magic, making the pests disappear overnight.
meanings.sent5: The smell of pesticide lingered in the air, a reminder of a job well done.
